name: Grand Beach Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed in a bayview suite. Partly seaview. Clean room with a very good bed. Staff friendly and very helpfull. Forgot a view items and before we left Florida could pick these up after sending an mail. Swimmingpool a little bed dirty beds at arrving there end of afternoon. Should be cleaner.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this ''gem" during an internet search and drove down to Miami Beach to see it before booking a room. When we arrived we loved the location. Directly on the beach! We asked the front desk staff if we could see a room before making a final decision to stay and were escorted by a bellman to an available room. We were so impressed with the room we checked in immediately. The decor is "cloud" white and comfy. There is a living area with a sofa bed, a full bath, a smaller bath with a shower only, a seperate (but not walled off) bedroom with large mirrored his/her closets. A mini-bar with fridge and snack bar ($) with bottled water and sweet and salty snacks are also available. There are very comfortable robes hanging in the closet that we practically lived in when we weren't on the beach. The outdoor restaurant was well-staffed and the food was very good. I highly recommend this hotel if you want to stay away from the Collins Avenue party crowd but also be close to the action for a short cab ride.
reviews.title: Beautiful location, fabulous room!

reviews.text: I am extremely pick when it comes to hotels, and we were pleasantly surprised with this hotel stay. The rooms are beautiful, the beds are extremely comfortable and we had a great view of the marinas. The room was spacious with two TV's etc. We ate at the restaurant and ordered room service. Quality of both were great. Pools are not huge, but there are two and the beach is right outside.

reviews.text: I was a little nervous staying here after reading the reviews but it turned out to be really nice and was not bad at all! The rooms are all white like the pictures and the view is amazing (we had a 1 bdrm suite w/ 2 bathrooms and 2 balconies) There were a few stains on the carpet which were reported immediately to the front desk and the mgr Jose compensated us which was really nice. There is a nice pool on the 7th fl for adults only and although the main pool is nice as well, you need to get there early to get a spot as there were many small children there. They should def work on getting more chairs out there. Beach is beautiful and yes you do have to pay $10 for each chair and umbrella I think it's worth it. The restaurant Chez Gaston has great food (you can also order from the pool + beach) but the menu is a little small and should have a little more variety. Be prepared as this is miami and the food + drinks are pricey but hey your on vacation! Hotel is in a perfect location.....far away enough to relax if you want to hang on the beach all day but close enough (about a $12 cab ride) to the action if thats your thing. The staff is extremely helpful and so professional which was a pleasant surprise. The only other thing I would suggest is they let ppl know they will need to leave a $75/night deposit on your cc, this is not mentioned on the website or confirmation email which is a little misleading. All in all it was nice and I will def be back.
reviews.title: Resort feel.....will be back

reviews.text: My family and I stayed here from Dec.26-29 - beautiful room, spectacular views, and great balcony - having said that, our room lacked the promised refrigerator( we purchased food for the room prior to check in for a few meals - down the drain) and balcony chairs (until I insisted!) - However, we found the valet parking to be super - never had to wait longer than 5 minutes, the pools great, and beach super, food ok (just had breakfast) No vending or ice machines anywhere....overall though impressive hotel.
reviews.title: grand views, grand location, but opening jitters

reviews.text: Went to visit family on Miami Beach and this was our first experience with this hotel. I have stayed at many hotels and chains but I have never seen service like this. The restaurant is horrible, staff can barely speak english. They were out of caesar dressing for the caesar salad, at least 5 paninis on the menu but they couldn't make them that night, the cuban sandwich was like rubber, and for the kids...the cheeseburger meal consisted of one slider which was barely a mouthful. Valet service, called down to get the car was told we can ask them but its still on a first come first serve basis when you get downstairs. It took nearly 25 minutes to get the car. For a new hotel, they need some work on hospitality if they want to survive in this economy!
reviews.title: Unbelievable!
